Keep going 15 minutes on the trail to the right going downriver and you get to a beautiful lake. 

Trail was very easy to follow, not overgrown at all. Just a couple detours that may have been tricky without the app. 

Saw a dozen or so sets of hikers along the way. 

Park at the end of Perrin Road. If the gate is open, you can drive a little further down, but not much.

What a beautiful waterfall and river ! After a bit of a disheartening walk in due to assholes who’ve dumped garbage, the journey was more than worth it ! Sat and explored the falls area for almost an hour but could have just stayed there all day !  Wonderful experience !
Pretty falls, however I don’t think I’d return, path is somewhat overgrown and unmarked.
Nice short hike beautiful waterfalls x 2
Was an ok short run. I wanted to try it out to see the falls. Was worth it this one time. May come and hike it with my kids. But won’t come for a run again.
Great hike tons of wet spots and mud but the falls were awesome with the extra water
Lovely trail. Very very muddy in parts but you can usually get around it with some crafty footwork. The falls are such a nice treat.

it was a great afternoon (Mar 24) and although it was VERY muddy, we were able to go around a lot of the mud sections through the brush. We still ended up with muddy shoes but the little snack break at the falls was absolutely worth it. Had my 8-year-old with me and he really enjoyed the hike. You start at the ATV trail and it's so unfortunate that people felt this was an area suitable for dumping. Once you get past the ATV trails and the garbage, it is a pretty little hike.
the extra 2km to soldier lake is worth it. beautiful views. well marked from the falls to the lake. the hike in to the falls was super muddy.

Great trail, just don't miss the path to the right (don't stay on the road too long)  It is pretty muddy,  but it's spring - you have to expect that.  Not too muddy for hiking boots.  The falls are well worth the trek.
Very Muddy!
A little wet after a snow storm.

Rugged terrain. Need to watch where you're going always. Very thin ice sheets with water below, need to walk around. Only a path from people walking it in. 2 garbage dumps along the way. Orange markers, need to be updated, but still helpful. Beautiful falls in the middle of nowhere suddenly appear.
Never disappoints!
Mucky as expected but good overall.
It was a nice hike, but lots of muddy stretches and some icy sections. Very nice view of the falls at the end.
Trail is good, but muddy and slippery with ice in spots.  But the falls are worth it.

Beautiful spring day, the start of the trail is somewhat of a 4 wheeler trail, muddy in many spots. That short part is well worth the effort. From the  falls along the the river to Soldier Lake is spectacular!
Great walk in the sunshine. The path’s a bit boggy in parts as the ice melts but slip on ice grips on the boots made life easy. The waterfall and river looked great so well worth the effort
fine trail in winter.
Snow was well packed for most of the trail, falls were beautiful!
Great for snowshoeing today and the icy falls at the end were beautiful!
Well to loose packed snow today. Excellent hiking conditions.  Nice to see a few others enjoying the trail.
Very muddy after the heavy rain yesterday, but enough well-used dry by-passes to get through. Amazing waterfalls.
Well used trail. Easy walk nice terrain
4 wheeler like trail. Great walk. Little icy

The hike itself was just ok. ATV trails, lots of logging taking place, and the trail was quite icy today, but once to the falls it’s so pretty! There are trees all along the side of the falls and river so it’s quite picturesque once you get there. Great for a late afternoon hike.

Beautiful hike and not heavily trafficked. We missed the turnoff to the falls the first time we went, but ran into people who told us where to go. My friends went back the next day and said it was well worth the hike. Making sure to keep an eye out for the first train (offshoot) to your right up a hill to get on the right track taking you to the falls. It's about 5-10 minutes from the starting point. Spikes and/or a walking stick are a good idea, as it's icy in spots this time of year.
Beautiful trail and the falls at the end are great. Only reason I would give this a 4 is because it is very icy at the moment. Would be a good idea to wear spikes or have a walking stick.
Beautiful hike.  Very doable with kiddos and dogs.  Trail was muddy and icy in areas today, but the falls made it well worth it.

Great little trail. Very easy hike and very child friendly. Lots of water and ice on the trail when we did it today in the middle of January so wear some nice water proof footwear. The falls were spectacular as it had just rained the night before.
Trail is very icy and muddy in spot so boots are a must. Work the short hike. Very nice waterfall.

The view of the falls at the end of this trail is amazing!!  So worth the hike.  The natural beauty throughout the trail is breathtaking as well.   We hiked after a snow storm,  and it was a winter wonderland.   The trail is narrow in places, but not a difficult hike.  I would consider some parts as moderate rather than easy, but definitely doable for all ages.  Some parts are a little rough, but go arounds have been made in places where there are large puddles.  Bring water and a snack, and definitely don't forget your camera!!  You can walk from the gate.  We have 4 wheel drive,  so we drove our truck to the trail head.  Not marked,  but easy to determine where the trail starts.
Great trail, easy to follow to beautiful falls.
Beautiful trail and waterfall. If you go in the winter bring poles and wear spikes on your hikers. Moderate difficulty. Enjoy!
you can drive your vehicle right up to the trail head past the gates, they're always open.
Lovely hike in the winter! Trail was a bit wet in places but otherwise in great condition.
Lovely!
Nice and easy beautiful snow covered trail. A tad icy.
Nice trail. Good trail for all ages. And worth the hike to the falls
It's a great trail but can be tricky getting to the start of the trail.  Someone marked the trail so you can find your way. You won't be disappointed when you reach the falls.
Beautiful cold day so not as muddy. Falls spectacular. Tricky to navigate so use  the App for navigation. Mine didn’t save completely-user issues Ha! Great trail.

The first section of this trail follows the natural gas pipeline. Sadly, you will pass large amounts of garbage that has been illegal dumped. Now, once into the woods things do get better. You will want good hiking shoes since some areas of the trail were wet when I went. Lots of single track to follow as someone has marked the trail with flagging tape, but don't let that stop ya. lots of areas to explore off the main trail . Keep in mind sections of this trail does enter a wildlife sanctuary.  IF YOU PACK IT IN, PLEASE PACK IT OUT.
Great trial- kid friendly. Very muddy!

The trail was amazingly easy to get to, but it doesn’t look like much. It’s primarily a quad-bike trail and because of that it’s pretty chewed up and you risk being greeted by bikes racing along. The few I encountered slowed down and tried not to splash me.; the trails are just wide enough that you can step to the side so they can pass. The ground was surprisingly wet and many places were very boggy, but it seemed that enough people walk here that there were often loops alongside the biggest puddles. There’s a fair bit of noise from the bikes, so it’s not a very quiet area, and I wouldn’t recommend bringing a dog that might get nervous with the bike passing close by. I stopped about half way as it was just getting too boggy and approaching the woods I felt it would be even more muddy— with return another time to hopefully see the falls!

It was worth the trek to see the falls￼. Some old forest. It maybe a little Challenging for seniors or a little kids.
It was sad to see humans dumping their house waste by the side of the pathway.
Some should lock the gate to vehicles￼
Loved it! Great little hike and beautiful waterfall, only downside is seeing garbage from people dumping.
So much garbage. Never did find the mythical falls.
Easy to follow, just go left.  Should have good footwear, mucky spots.  Once at falls well worth the hike.

The first 700m of the trail is not pretty, and the service road is shamefully strewn with dumped garbage. But get past that and the reward is a beautiful lightly trafficked footpath that follows the Johnson River from the falls down to Soldier Lake, with serene points along the waterway to listen to the rapids. Well worth the time!
Great trail to take my group of dogs, heavy for ticks and road kill is dropped off at times so be prepared if your dogs are off leash. Crazy muddy in the summer, it’s nicer there in the winter.
took a back road route
Nice falls, but the trail was muddy, full of garbage, and kind of boring at the start.
The falls are nice.  It is disappointing to see that people use the trail to dump their household garbage.
I went after a rainy day so there were lots of puddles and mud, but it was a nice trail. Definitely meant for 4 wheelers, but nice none the less.

This was a nice trail to walk! make sure you check your map, as this is an ATV trail, so there are lots of forks in the road and trails everywhere, we did get a bit off track and realized after about 30 mins then had to turn around and take the map out, other than that, very pretty! There is some bush watching, took us about 2 hours, in and out!
Beautiful falls. Trail was busy with ATVs and people.  Sadly had to walk past piles of garbage that had been dumped.
Pretty reasonable trail , app definitely helps to keep you on track.  The falls are wonderful

What a lovely fall walk! We avoided in spring due to flies and ticks but yesterday was gorgeous- the foliage is colourful and the fall is running fast after a couple of big rains. It’s an easy hike but can be wet and uneven. There is not a trail marker for when you vere  to right to head into falls. It’s after a few hundred metres on logging road.  Cell reception is good so helps to check on map provided here. You can walk to lake: about 500 m beyond the falls. A beautiful fall hike!
The fall colours were nice.
Awesome hike
Can be a little confusing getting on the right path. Keep an eye out for trail markers along the way. Beautiful fall colors are starting to appear along the trail.
Very nice easy walk with family. Waterfall was very nice

This trail is all about the destination which is beautiful . You can hike further along and end up at Soldier lake for a swim which is nice. Liike others have said over 1/2 is old logging road/ATV trail and 90% is through recently clear cut scrub so not very scenic. Nice falls tho’
Great trail but definitely confusing forks. Wouldn’t have made it to the falls without the app. First fork - right. Second fork - right. Third fork - LEFT. Gorgeous falls and worth the hike!

Great short trail. Easily manageable for most abilities. Thankful for the advice in previous reviews on direction as it is not marked. The first and second fork go right and the third fork go left . Beautiful falls is the reward.
good trail. easy to finish for all skill levels. there is a fork in the road about 500 m in but if you stick to the right you should be fine. pretty cool waterfall at the end as well
fabulous. loved it all. stick right at the start of the forks in the 'road' section
easy to walk, well marked and water was refreshing
ATV trails have a lot of garbage, was pretty disappointing to see. Lots of Forks in the road and way to the falls is not well marked, without the all trails map I wouldn't have found the falls.
Full of garbage. Atv trail

Great little trail, super hot out there today. There is zero shade. The waterfall was wonderful and very refreshing for a dip before heading back. Followed the previous reviewers directions at the forks, luckily, we didnt find it to be well marked.

Really enjoyed this trail! Although we may have gone down a wrong trail without a map and the Great advice from the previous review to follow the markers on the trees. Without that knowledge we may not have found it as there are 2 separate forks in the road. The marked trail will lead you right to the falls!
After the 4 wheel trail turns into a walking trail it becomes a bit overgrown with blueberry bushes but nothing extreme. My 8 year old hiked it with ease. Well worth the hike to get to the waterfall! 
It had just down poured the last 2 days so there’s some big puddles to maneuver around but the falls were roaring!! Spectacular!
Lots of horse flies! Bring bug spray and a hat

Giving 4 stars based on the type of trail - gravel roadway giving way to a woodsy trail that ends at a very pretty waterfall. This was an easy walk in, pleasant on a cooler day as there is little shade. As everyone has mentioned - garbage - but it is only in a few spots. The horseflies were terrible so we were glad to have worn long sleeves and pants. Also glad to have downloaded the map as recommended - there are quite a few different trails but the one marked takes you right to the falls. We couldn’t figure out the loop around the falls, crossed the river and followed the tape for a bit but when we lost that trail we went back the way we came. Some nice wildflowers, lots of birds and chipmunks
Bring sunscreen and bug spray.

decent trail leads to some beautiful scenic areas. actual foot path portion of the trail is a little over grown but easy to follow. 

as noted previously, the trail starts as an access road, moves onto a fairly wide atv trail, followed by a single file path through the bush.   

lots of horseflys about and buzzing our heads and arms. they were very annoying. 

to note: a number of random places along the atv trails where inconsiderate people have dumped garbage.

Loved it. Over half is on a service/ATV road, then through a path in the woods, overgrown but still can see where it goes. I recommend downloading the map to have for back up as I took a quick wrong turn once or twice as its not marked. 

60 minutes in and out. Spent about 20 minutes outside of that just at the falls letting my dog swim.

It was kind of dried out when I went (despite it raining for a few days). The path is full of frogs, and some small snakes. Overgrown and slightly thorny, you’re going to need pants. Probably more worth it in the fall

Trail was not bad. Starts off as a service road for the natural gas pipeline, turns off on to an ATV trail. Multiple forks, all seem to still eventually lead to the waterfall. Waterfall is great.   A lot of garbage in a couple spots on the trail. Wish I had an effective means to remove it.

Gorgeous waterfall and a fairly quick hike. The trail isn’t super well marked - for the forks, we went 1) right 2) straight/left 3) straight/left. A previous commenter said to stay right until the end but when we went right at the second fork, we were headed way off course. There is a lot of household garbage dumped at the beginning of the trail - it’s honestly a bit shocking to see big pieces of furniture, old paint cans, etc.... It took us about 25 mins each way, with a dog and a child. It was very buggy at the waterfall.

It definitely was a super hot day to attempt this trail.

But I did it. I do suggest using the map to follow the trail. It makes it really easy to navigate to the fall.

It took me about 25 mins to walk to the falls, and about 25 mins around the falls for pictures and 25 back out!

a lot of the trail is open to the sun, with a few areas that are shaded.
good trail for ATV not so much for walking
Not great, multiple trails not super clear paths. Lots of garbage on the trail. Nice waterfall

My favourite trail by far! Certainly capable of any skill level until you reach the actual falls, then it’s quite a steep climb down. We followed advice from previous reviews to keep the app out so we could track our whereabouts - the trail is not marked at all and you will come to several forks in the road. We got lucky and found the falls our first time! It’s a gorgeous spot with flat land and shallow water access for camping or picnics. Our dogs loved it! There is a large gravel opening half way through the trail where there is lots of garbage from other campers, which was disappointing to see. Horseflies and ticks were HORRIBLE, but the waterfall was worth it! About 40 mins both ways. Beautiful views but some muddy spots after it rained day before. Bring sunscreen as most of the trail is in open sun. Watch your step for fallen logs and vines. All I can say for directions is stay far right at every fork except when you come to a grassy hill incline, stay straight -but you’ll hear the water by then! Loved it here.

I would suggest using the app to find your way since there are a lot of side trails. A fair amount of it is just gravel road but the further you get it turned in the more single track. Very scenic when you get to the waterfall I highly suggest this hike

4.5 stars. Only missing a half star because of the garbage and spilled oil everywhere at the first half of the trail. Second half is fantastic, not many bugs, the waterfall is great. It should be noted that the trail does continue after its marked on alltrails, it will lead you down to soldier lake which is a nice spot for a picnic. Would recommend!

Like others have said I started down the wrong trail to start but used the map, double backed and found the right one. Once in the trail it was easy to follow!
Lots of garbage around which is a shame.
Nice waterfall at the end!

If you’re going to do this hike, make sure that your phone has data so you can follow this map. There’s a lot of forks in the road so it’s good to have the map on so you know which way to go. I’d say it took about 30 minutes to get to the falls and about 20 minutes to get pack to the car...After you do it once, you may not need the map but it definitely saved my life. Beautiful waterfall!!
easy to moderate hike, follow the red markers, not hard to follow. beautiful falls at the end
Awesome trail. I took advice of other reviews and found it easy to navigate with the map. Great spot!
Nice hike , definitely tricky to navigate if you aren’t following the map because there’s lots of forks . We made it to the falls, was a nice reward

bit tricky to navigate through all the twists and turns of the dirt bike tracks so just keep an eye on the map. Saw a pheasant but otherwise not a lot of wildlife spotting. as others have said unfortunately people have dumped household garbage around the trails. Waterfall is really beautiful though :)
A lot of garbage and waterfall isn’t easy to access
great hike! ended with some very muddy shoes. unfortunately a lot of garbage

The trail is meh right now since the greenery hasn’t come in yet, but the waterfall at the end is very nice. The first bit of the trail is a road, then it turns into an ATV route. I will mirror the comment below, at one point the ATV route goes right and you need to continue straight to hit the waterfall so keep an eye on your maps!

The trail forked and we wound up taking the wrong path so we didn't make it to the falls but it did lead us to a beautiful lake. early season so it was very muddy and lots of ATVs out digging trenches into the path. we're definitely going to go back and hike on the right trail though.

Full train information can be found in Benoit Lalonde's book "Waterfalls of Nova Scotia"

First quarter of the trial is on a dirt road. Unfortunately people have elected to use the road as a place to dump household items in a few locations. The remainder or the trail is through a clear cut, that was likely cut more than a dozen years ago. The trail through the clear cut follows the rough roads used for logging machinery. I notice red flagging tape through the clear cut portion of the train. The scenery is unremarkable and the waterfall is not a scenic as others in the book.

A wonderful easy walk!! Parking limited before where gravel road starts. It would be great if the path could be marked, because right now people have formed dozens of paths, trampling vegetation as they go.
STUNNING. Even on a cloudy day!
Excellent view. Best spot so far I’ve seen on the trail.

Aug 2021, beautiful afternoon hike. We went counter clockwise around the loop which offered amazing cliff side views and large waves crashing against rock on the way to the point. This left the way back to be much less dramatic. The hike was pretty easy. Not much elevation. It was perfect for our second hike of the day. The views and atmosphere are definitely worth the visit.
This place is Incredible!! I highly recommend coming here when it's windy if you wanna see some monster waves! and also follow the coastline trail for few kilometers. Enjoy..

My favorite trail in Nova Scotia. Outside the Cabot Trail but very scenic ride to get there. Easy walk up to the top with nice lookout at the end. Can’t get any better than that. You can see seals from there. As what everyone else said, park on the street just before the gravel path.

We hit this trail on a spectacular sunny and hot day. Park at the end of the paved road and don’t try to drive up the dirt road unless you have a Jeep as it is rutted and rocky and you can get stuck up there unable to turn around if too many people go there to park. This is a delightful coastal trail with so many paths to follow. Magnificent views of the coastline in both directions. Small pioneer graveyard and a cross to the Unknown Sailor. Nice walk to do with younger children too. Easy walk.
Amazing, short, easy, beautiful! Favourite hike in Cape Breton so far!
Amazing views, great hike for little ones and a very different trail as it’s all open.

First time for us on this trail. Parked just where the paved road ends. You can drive another 100m or so but it’s a bit rocky and not a lot of parking there. Views are spectacular to say the least! We climbed down the rocks on the very end of the peninsula, dipped our toes in the water and listened to the surf.  Well worth it!!

This was one of my favourite points on Cape Breton Island. Short and easy stroll/hike to various coastal cliff views and you can scramble to get a little closer to the water. Every turn felt like a new surprise. I've never been to Scotland, but I'd imagine this is what it might look like.
Great coastal views; would definitely visit again. Troves of crowberries, and lowbush blueberries. Really interesting cemetary with plaque for the Unknown Sailor.
Nice walk out to the point with 5/5 views. Great on a sunny day.

this trail never disappoints.
today was very very windy but amazing as always.

Your skill level will dictate whether you view this as a hike or not but in any case, it’s an easy and well-worth-it side jaunt if you are in the area. Easy footing (rocky but flat and wide), minimal elevation gain and absolutely spectacular views. Awesome rock formations, wild untamed ocean vistas and an incredible view of the northern mountain range. This would be a great spot to pack a gourmet picnic, perhaps even make a proposal  Recommended
So beautiful, highly recommend if you are looking for some views!
very nice coastal walk, some uphill and lots of seabirds !

You will be happy you made the effort to find this point! The geology and coastline is quite stunning; wide open views of north mountain range. We were there in relative calm but I’m betting the waves and wind kick up there. We saw many seals, shore birds. There is the walk to the point; but we found a trail to the south east and continued a bit longer. Trail starts at the end of paved white point road; a gravel road between two homes.
Lovely look off. Very rugged. Easy walk.

Short but very beautiful. Saw an Eagle soaring over one of the coves. Definitely keep dogs on leash, some steep drop offs  and eroded edges. Looks like you're walking down someone's driveway at the start, if that's what you're thinking, you're in the right place!
We accidentally stumbled upon this, what a stunning surprise. It was sunset & it took my breath away!
Easy short trail with wonderful views. Lots of birds at the end!
We watched birds and saw minke whales and seals from the shore. Gorgeous spot.

short but awesome views. 

on our way back down, we saw a pod we believe pilot whales in the cove. 

definitely worth the drive to the trail. it is the perfect hike to finish off the day.

One of the most beautiful spots in Cape Breton. Its kid friendly but there are cliffs so keep them close. Be very careful on the rocks. My husband and I were climbing around and a boulder was loose and crushed his hand. He ended up losing a finger.
a must see if your around, feels like the edge of the earth
Awesome place that needs to be on the itinerary of every visitor to the area. It’s a beautiful, serene and easy place to explore, with an edge-of-the-earth type of feel.
love picking blueberries here
The view is gorgeous! Highly recommended!
Beautiful!!!!
Amazing views. Rocky terrain. Very windy. Recommend not driving up the dirt path, lots of pot holes. Park at the bottom of harbour.

Our favourite for ‘hanging out’ and exploring. Beautiful area, easy walk, very open.  

High traffic area out to and at the point, but we enjoy continuing further on the trail along the coastline-in doing so, we’ve been able to watch seals playing!  Please stay on trail though- Fragile vegetation! 

Parking not so great !
the view is breathtaking, eagles soaring around you and the ocean crashing into the cliffs. very accessible so anyone can do it. less traffic that skyline trail I highly recommend this!
Very nice trail and views! Parking a bit tricky but worth it!
I got engaged here, so I’m biased. But totally worth seeing if you have some time. Easy walk and cool things to see

You won’t regret this wrong turn on your way to the (insert New England accent here) CHOWDER HOUSE! 

The Scottish highlands dressed in drag with a coke problem - this highly unseen pastor of couples in love and screaming birds, ready to rip the Venus from your heart.

Dressed as a young schoolboy I stayed close to the edge of the cliff while fighting the urge to jump into the water and join the unidentified squawking birds. Tourists: we hate them as much as we need them. Praise the unidentified sailor buried there.
Randonnée facile, mais spectaculaire! Excellent endroit où aller voir le coucher du soleil.
impressionnant !
The best trail we did in Cape Breton.  Very short but very grand looking.  You can see many birds.  Highly recommend.

Very easy hike with spectacular views. So in easy in fact you could pack a gourmet lunch and hike to a spot and then eat while enjoying some of the best views in Cape Breton. Drive up the hill to the right of house number 2119 and you will find a wide area off to the right where you can park and start your hike.
Really just walking around a lookout. Unknown grave marker near the end.
Beautiful trail to go on at sunset. We were there by ourselves most of the time.
Really great views... can watch ships on horizont and birds on small island near by!

adorer! sentier facile pour les debutants comme moi et le decor et vraiment beau! c’est un décor différent du reste de la cabot trail mais en voyant toujours les montagnes au loin! on a aperçu des baleines non loin des berges!
Concur with all the 5 star reviews here. Be prepared for strong winds.
A nice walk out on a point - very peaceful! It smells amazing too, there must be some herbs growing. We saw lots of whales from the point too!

Must see. Park by the harbour at the bottom. We walked to the end and back to our car within an hour.

Probably the most unique trail on the Cabot trail

Just a must do! Amazing trail with awsome view! Very windy! Give it an hour or so to take in the beauty and to explore the little trails! Go also right, nice beach! I recommend parking at the little harbour.
We walked this trail Thursday and it was beautiful! A must see short hike along the Cabot trail. The view is spectacular! Great for kids as well.

This is an easy trail on a treeless point so there is almost 360 degree view of ocean and rocky cliffs. One could just spend the day there and just take in the views. It is simplest to park in the town Harbour and walk the dirt road for 50 yards to start the trail which is never in the woods. Bring your lunch and find a large rock otherwise head back into the Harbour and there is a picnic table. If you are on the Cabot Trail don’t miss this beautiful easy hike.
Fantastic trail do not miss it. A short walk to see a great view. I mountain biked it and had a great time. Some great cliffs & rock formations.
Absolutely amazing views! Some of the best on the Cabot trail! A must see!
Gorgeous lookouts, you can do it as a loop, peer down into the little coves to see large groups of purple jellyfish, lovely sound of shorebirds at the end
Favorite place!
Great trail that leads to a breathtaking view of the Atlantic and the Grave of the Unknown Sailor.
Great!
Great trail. Lots of spots to stop near the water. Can get quite muddy. Most parts of the trail have a ton of roots - watch your step!
Water was warm! Great place to go for a dip.

Trails are beautiful through trees and lake views. Waterfall is gorgeous. Although it is an easy trail, be warned that it's not suitable for a stroller as the ground is not flat. Some tree hiking is required which we love, but I realize it's not for everyone.
Beautiful trail. Serene views of the lake. Tracker was helpful at parts. Worth wearing hiking boots, it was muddy in places.
beautiful, muddy!

Romantic hike, on the easier side of moderate. Not heavily traveled.  Many muddy spots but you can usually skirt around or use stepping stones (roots, logs). Many warblers. Many spots on the lake and ravine to sit and have a snack or sit and dream.

What a beautiful hike! Not very busy at 9:00 AM on a sunny Saturday. Little muddy especially on the keg through the woods. We did that leg first. When you get to the River, take a left before crossing the River. About 10 minutes down is a bridge, waterfall and bench. You walk along the River until you get to Long Lake and then you walk along the west shore. Path is fairly easy to follow for the most part. The app was helpful when finding the turns.
was a bit muddy. Not alot of people there, well marked path.

I thoroughly enjoyed this hike. We started off on the regular Long Lake trail but there were quite a few people out that day so we decided to veer off onto this trail, which had less people to pass. I didn't realize at the time of the trail name. We hiked along what looked like a creek bed and came to the most beautiful little stream/river, where we stopped for a snack. I had my two young boys and my parent with me - it was great for all ages! We followed the river back, saw the water falls and then followed the lake edge back the rest of the way. Just a perfect day and a lovely trail.

Great trail, much. Iced views than I expected.

Very muddy.
I absolutely loved this trail ... walking along the river was just beautiful
Pretty wet and muddy this time of year. Still a little bit of ice too.

Drove past many times but never checked this trail out till today.  Snowy and icy but warm sunny day make it just soft enough to provide very good footing.  On the way out it was starting to get muddy.  Very nice old growth woods, following the stream and lake gave some really nice views.  Will be have to check it out in the summer and fall.
beautiful but rocky, wet, and slippy. glad I had my GPS going on my phone. trail was a bit hard to follow at points.
Great trail, a bit icy in spots but such a nice hike
Icy! Even with ice grippers, tricky.
Awesome little hike. A bit of everything and a nice waterfall surprise
Beautiful trail, not marked but not difficult to follow. Used Crampons which were very useful due the amount of fresh ice under the new snow cover. Must return in the spring.

Nice trail. I needed the map the whole time but if you just follow the river up the hill and around you shouldn’t need it. Lots of flooded places, waterproof shoes are a must. I had to carry my 8 pound dog over lots of flooded areas but once you get to the top and start descending down the right side it’s so beautiful
Slippery, muddy, icy, puddles, but a beauty of a hike!

Such a nice trail! Easy to get lost in all the side trails out there especially as someone knew to the area. Kinda boggy and the path is full of roots and rocks which is fun and not boring! You follow the lake edge and then follow a small stream to a waterfall that’s way prettier in real life. Lots of moss and beautiful colours. Lots of dogs as well, I brought mine and they loved it. Will be going back!

Long Lake Provincial Park is a short 10-15 minute drive from the city. Located near a subdivision, this is a popular spot to visit. Since this place is close to the city, they did make sure to ensure ample parking.

I found as though the trail intersections could have been better labelled, as we had a bit of an issue finding the correct one back to the car. 

You can access the lake in several different spots where you can swim if you'd like. The only ones in the lake when I was there were a couple of doggie friends! 

There is no admission, and as far as I'm aware, no services - including no washrooms. 

Trails are easy

The look off is beautiful but not easy to get to. There is a rope to help you up the steep hill.

Have been a couple of times. Never dissapointed. Beautiful view from steep climb to top of mine peak (beside lake access). Awesome place to swim; especially refreshing after a long day on the trails. Easy to do trek in flipflops. Would love to come in the winter for skating!
This is a great hike for beginners. It’s short and sweet, with a beautiful view at the peak. The color of the lake water is so beautiful, and clear enough for one to swim.
trail OK. bugs very bad. worth it.
Beautiful view
Beautiful short hike, stunning lake view, dog friendly and easy enough for small children

Walk in is ATV trail so pretty underwhelming but the lake is simply stunning! The water is so beautiful, and the hike up the hill to get the best view is fun! Exploring in around the lake is cool with the rock cliffs. Would love to go back in the summer.
Lovely walk. Well marked. Good family hike. Rope uphill is frayed at the top of the second ascent.
Well trafficked and maintained trail. Easy to follow to the mine. The climb to the top has ropes provided to help you. Was a little hard coming back down with snowshoes on.
Beauty, will do it again.
Very easy, short hike but the lake is spectacular. Be sure to follow the trail up to the cliff to get the full view!
beautiful view
Short walk on a dirt road and a climb to the view. Very easy.
Nice quick walk and climb for great photo op. Too busy to sit and enjoy the top. Very nice down at the lake.
Fantastic weather and views.

beautiful views. 
very short. 
we got there just before it got very busy. some people we felt were pushy and didn't wait for children to pass.
What a view!
Was lucky enough to be there by myself for a bit of time. I sat up top and enjoyed the view then walked down and chilled a bit by the water. The type of place you just sit and appreciate.
Short and sweet. Quick and easy hike

The trail was easy, however the look off portion is tricky. BUT totally worth it! I would definitely recommend. 

Be mindful as I was looking for a cache and noticed a lot of used feminine hygiene products. :( If you're a woman, please don't do this, pack it up and take it with you. It's just gross.

Other then that, I will be back!

Absolutely stunning. But I was quite a walk up. The trail is frequented by ATVs, so it can get a little dusty. But once we reached to the lake, it was overcrowded. Difficult to find shade. But beautiful nonetheless
beautiful spot, but definitely overcrowded, as ppl mostly go there to swim and it's a very easy walk to the swimming spot.
super easy

Short 20 min hike to the lake on a dirt road.  Really pretty views, small trail on left side goes up 50 m to a look out, worth a peak. Lake was a nice swim... may want to bring some sort of floatation device as it’s deep right off the shore. Some kids were jumping off a cliff across the lake, there is a rope to climb up there. 
My recoding is messed as I forgot to shut it off.  There is parking at the entrance. It was super busy when we left.

It was overcrowded when we went. Sun was a tad high, which made the walk up kind of difficult. hard to find shade even though the place was surrounded by trees. The lake was smaller than expected. But we got really nice pictures from the top.
Casual stroll to an over crowded once quiet location. If you're out for the same picture all of socual media shows, you'll get it. Not a unique experience whatsoever.
Beautiful and so easy to get to! Water was perfect for a swim
Look off is worth the extra hike and steepness
Dirt roads that leads to a lake. The water was warm but it gets deep very quickly.
Trail itself is not that long and you basically are walking on an atv trail but gypsum mine itself is so beautiful and worth the visit. Water was warm and I enjoyed the swim
Not much overhead shade. Best done when the sun is a little lower in the sky. If doing with kids, take a life jacket or floatation device as the lake is deep with no shore line. Beautiful spot.

Not the most scenic walk to the lake but such a beautiful view at the end! Follow signs for the lake and when you arrive at the lake shore, to your left there will be an obvious path and some ropes to climb up to a lookout over the lake. The ropes are mostly there for balance and it is pretty easy to get up to the lookout.
Super easy walk to a beautiful view and place to stop for a swim!

There is a short and relatively easy trail to the gypsum lake. There is a steep but short climb to overlook lake, with ropes. A new trail has been developed; fairly well marked and moderate; follows ridge above the lake. Lots of perching birds in the area! Good swimming as well.
Worth every step! Truly beautiful views.

Really nice, short and super easy. It would be a good one to do with kids, the best look out spots are on top of some precarious rocks but the hike itself is more just a service road.  We tried to follow a path to the rocks across the water but it was severely overgrown and not particularly worth it for the view on that side. Still really nice !

A nice little quick attraction you can get done in an hour, unless you want to go for a swim and spend time at the pond. The trail is simply a road that leads you to the pond, although some of the scenery along the way isn't bad. You'll need to go up and down a small but steep hill using ropes that have been made available in order to get the most photographic view. If you don't ascend the hill, you might not get much from this experience unless you go swimming. But the ropes are fun and the view from above is beautiful, so this is worth a go for sure.

Such an easy beautifull hike!

Just make sure you use the rope and go up to see the lake overlook view. Stunning!
Picturesque. Pretty easy, quick walk. Use the ropes and go up to get a higher view.

Wow!!!
Such a beautiful place to visit!
Definitely take the trail up to the top to get an amazing view overhead. There are ropes in place and they should be used as part of the path up the hill is quite steep.
Fun little walk. The views of the lake were lovely. Best views if you use the ropes climb up a bit higher.

A dirt road to a fair uphill climb for those mobility impaired, decent but not as easy as those all the time describe, worth it to get to a beautiful lake. If you are up to it, def take the road assisted climb to a beautiful view
Beautiful view if you scramble up the ropes to look down over the lake at the top.

If you’re in the Cheticamp area, I think it’s a must that you stop at the gypsum mine. It is super accessible and easy to get to, within minutes. If you’d like to stay for a picnic or go cliff jumping / swimming, this is an awesome place to do so! 10/10 make sure you climb up the side trail to see a beautiful view of the picturesque mine!
Ein Feldweg zum örtlichen Badesee. Netter anblick, mehr nicht. Sehr viele Menschen unterwegs.
The first part to the lake is just a dirt road so not very interesting but the lake is a treat at the end. It is worth the climb to see the lake from the height of the cliff.
Easy walk in a dirt road with slight elevation at the end. Beautiful view using the ropes up to the left of the lake.

Gypsum mine lake is a pretty simple trail.  Google maps shows a road that goes to it but you cant take a car down it so you will have to park at the gate and walk the rest. the lake has a nice greenish-blue color to it and is somewhat clear. that is an option to go up higher for a better view. There are ropes to help you climb up since it gets pretty steep at times, but the view is worth it.

great trail for partial shade walks, birds, squirrels, chipmunks, flora and lots of different fungi. I'm very overweight and out of shape and found this trail just challenging enough to raise my heart rate but not exhaust me. Wear your bug spray and of course check for ticks when you get home.
Easy little trail. Also very beautiful. Hiked it when it was kinda cold and it catches some of those ocean breezes. Close to the city so you can do it quick.
Nice quick ride from one lake to another!
beautiful, easy trail. hard to believe it's right in the middle of the city.
Great family spot, stroller friendly, lots to see and do. Parking lot with washroom and garbage cans available, trail is nice and lots to see, usually pretty busy.
Loved it little windy can’t wait to come back
Lots of wildlife to see and many different paths for options!
Very icy.
love this place!

cooler and lovely today
Great ride !
Nice walking trails, very wel kept.
always a favorite

pretty walk. boat rentals add an interesting way to explore canal and Lake Charles.  The are multi use trails so take care as bikes can go by fast.  Also there is an off-leash dog area that covers almost half the park.
great for a daily walk. very scenic views..lots of rest places..easy travel.
I love this trail! it's nice for an easy walk that anyone can do, very shady on hot days and beautiful view at the beach :) very dog friendly too
great trail, stroller friendly!

Very easy trail, very easy to follow. Many trails to follow such as one for dogs on leash and off leash. Most people are very friendly there and there’s a baseball field that you can let the dogs out into before the walk to let them run around
Nice sunny day. Hills make it more interesting and challenging.

I have walked through Shubie park. I like it!

-9C/-18 with windchill. Snow and ice.
Snow and ice well under control.
Took my dog for a walk, several off leash areas. The place is always clean with a beautiful view and is also pretty big. My fav park in Dartmouth.
Got to run with the dog off leash !
Love Shubie trail

I walk this trail every weekday morning with a group of men and it is perfect for our group. The trails are kept in excellent shape and better yet the park keepers are a very friendly lot. We walk for an hour or so, then it is off to Tim's for social time. This fall there was a concerted effort to make the trails free of obstacles. So it should be quite ideal for skiing if we get snow that stays.
Great place for a walk. Easy trails. Lots of squirrels and birds. Lots of places to stop. Great place to go during any season.
best dog park in town & my rating is based on that.
Excellent gentle ramble for all ages . Reasonably picturesque and perfect for loads of off leash dog walking. Brilliantly  maintained trails here .
Easy easy family and pet friendly trail. Well kept crusher dust trails perfect for walking, running, and biking.
Great trial has something for everyone
A dog's heaven!  Lots of water and plenty of off leash areas.  Very easy hike, but very icy in the winter.  The trail connects to the trans Canada trail!

Loved it. Was a beautiful, easy walk. If you bought a sound machine and hit the waterfall button, that’s what it sounds like. And it smelled amazing too. An odd thing to notice but we went just after a rainfall and the air smelled so clean and fresh!

We didn’t try the river trial but waterfall trial is awesome  Also, if you use google map for navigation. Never turn right on big beddeck road extension ( turn right will save you 2 minutes drive ) because the road is closed for vehicles  ( however, you can still walk tot the park ,probably 2 minutes walk )  please turn left on big beddeck road extension and drive for 7 minutes you will see a sign showing you how to go to this provincial park
We really liked it!!  Takes a bit to get to the fun part of the trail.  Could not record this one as we couldn’t get service.

Nice trail, easy going until you reach the end at the waterfall, where it gets more difficult, and you have to climb over rocks. Well worth the effort though, beautiful water falls. Unfortunately, the River Trail was closed, so this shortened the hike a lot.

the trail itself is fine - very easy and maintained. It is such a spectacular waterfall and an easy 30 minute hike in.
Trail was well maintained, an easy hike in and out.

Always love visiting these falls. Trail is well maintained and doable for all skill levels young and old. Water was nice, got in for a dip.

Great hike for the entire family!  The falls are nice but the trees growing on top of the boulders and wrapping their roots around the rocks are amazing!

fun walk

It was a very beautiful hike, very easy. We met a lot of retired couples on the trail, as well as families and their dogs. I definitely recommend if you’re looking for something quick and easy.

Beautiful hike with some fun boulder climbing as you get closer to the falls. Loved the muddy conditions and how the trail snakes the river all the way through. Bridge is out on the loop but in and out is available.  Gorgeous waterfall and very peaceful hike.  Not at all busy.
Very nice trail.

some areas to take caution of where the trail has washed out a bit bit the entire trail is beautiful view upon beautiful view the whole way up and when you think it cannot get any nicer, keep going and you find the stunning view at the base of the falls. So happy a friend recommended this.

Beautiful!! We did this hike in March so there was lots of snow but the trail was well maintained and the falls were amazing as they thawed ! Part of the trail was closed because the bridge was out - didn’t affect our hike.

May 05 2019. The beginning of the trail has some hard packed ice still but that does stop shortly after the branch off for the River trail. The River trail is closed due to washed out bridges and there are some isolated muddy spots but otherwise the main Falls trail is fine and still easily hiked.

This is the most beautiful trail I've ever been on. The sunlight filtering through the leaves makes the air look fresh and green. If you stand quietly, deer may take the opportunity to cross the trail. Watch for frogs.

Nice woodland walk along to a waterfall which is rather pretty. Sadly, the River Trail which would make this a bit longer and more interesting walk is closed as there.is a bridge out. Looks like it’s been closed a while, but it’s still worth a trip as is.

Great hike, warm day 27c temps, dirt road last 4km to Falls parking lot but ok, washrooms, no flies at least this day, the trail to the Falls is roughly an hour return trip back to the parking lot, lots to see, bring a camera, smartphone camera ok but no service.

the best !!
15 min hike in! swimmable falls pool! 
a must do!

A beautiful short hike, pet friendly and kid friendly, along a running river, lush greenery, to a heavy running waterfall. For experienced hikers-take a left at the small waterfall, scramble up a side trail to explore the large waterfall and pool.
A great hike and a beautiful falls to explore! Trail has been cleaned, however, parking is not permitted at the trail head. Fun for all ages!
Didn’t find the falls. Started to rain.

Very rough walk in as the woods road is heavily rocked and washed out in areas. The falls were very nice and there are some old stone structures to see, but they are close to the entrance. The rest of the trail is like walking any old woods road. Very easy despite the rocky start. Great for kids!

Dumping grounds at beginning of trail, lots of large deep 'puddles' that are very difficult to navigate around. very poorly marked trail and I missed the falls completely even though I stayed on the main trail
Little buggy, the falls were really cool. Not sure what’s passed it, I didn’t continue because it looks like just ATV trail in the woods.
One of the worst trail in Nova Scotia . Full of garbage and nothing special to see . Doesn’t worth the drive at all
A little garbage at the beginning.  A little uneven.  Just need to watch your footing.  More of a service road.  The waterfall is near the beginning.
Nice day for a walk on the trail. A bit wet in spots

Parked on the street and walked the service road, no signage and we did end up walking for quite a while down the wrong road, hint- go on the service road and d do not deviate until you see the bridge...turn right into the woods to get to the Falls.   You can hike past the falls into the woods which is the only highlight here.  As mentioned previously there is a lot of garbage (not litter garbage, things like an old washing machine..,it looked to be a common dump site for locals(?) along the service road.  Very easy terrain to get to the mouth of the falls, not as accessible to go further so if mobility is a concern just enjoy the falls as it is rocky if you continue.  Having done it once won’t bother going back.  Not challenging enough yet the falls are pretty.
I was disappointed with the amount of garbage. But the falls were lovely. Easy to navigate and great distance to the falls with my kiddos.
It's nice, its great that we can use the road to get to it. I walked past the 5rail and continued a ways up beautiful lake, peaceful and serene

Nice trail, you can follow the stream up really far in the woods and I really enjoyed that. Lots of people though and many in groups of more than 5, so social distancing in some spots was tricky.
Georgous falls and nice side trails along the river.
Great trail a little wet after the rain. Make sure not to park in front of the entrance.
beautiful trail at a beautiful time of the year.
Really icy
Enjoyed a family walk to the falls, beautiful spot! Simple wide trail, rocky in some areas, then a walk through the woods to the falls.

Trail is all down a gentle slope to the falls. Nothing to write home about until you get to the falls, which are gorgeous!
Very icy across the trail in a few parts and the hike back out is where you get your exercise, as it’s all uphill. I left my dog at home because I wasn’t sure what to expect, but it would have been great for her.
won't go back SUV was vandalize

This was a great trail for a wintery day. Definitely a little slippery in places but I managed in worn out blundstones. My dog is pretty good off leash and stays close by so I chose to do that; but there were ATVs so just keep an ear out and you should be OK — just watch the tire track puddles are deeper than they look. The best part about this trail is that you could stay on the main drag, which isn’t anything special, or there are lots of little off trail opportunities (unmarked) that bring to to gorgeous views of the snow covered river and the falls. Took us 2.5 hours to do 7.13km of walking on and off trail.
it was a beautiful day for this hike! the walk in was quite icy, but passable if you have ice piks or tread lightly.

The walk in is on an ATV trail which isn’t that exciting. However right before the bridge you take a right and the trail bends along the brook to the falls, which are lovely. Lots of little trails through the woods along the water, really quite nice once you’re in!

A fun moderate trail, with lots of little trails to explore. you could spend a day back here exploring easily.  
It is wilderness, so caution should be used if exploring off trail.

Lovely trail with several paths/ATV-trails off of it. The main trail is a mix of large granite rock or blue rock, and can get a bit uneven. The smaller trails are mostly trodden, mossy paths. The river and its streams are lovely and clear, with gravel bottoms. The falls are beautiful and the path is a little hidden compared to the larger ATV trails; the woods along the river are easy to walk through, so you could easily follow the river.  If you’re fit and have good balance and footing you can go on top of the falls, which I thought was the nicest view.
Sadly, it’s an open trail so many seem to have driven down to dump household waste so there’s a lot of scrap metal, and junk

We hiked in to the waterfall; the trail to right just before the bridge about 1.2 km down main trail. From there we hiked to and beyond waterfall to the power cut. About another 800 m- km. The old growth and moss covered, huge granite rocks were positively stunning. The waterfall is significantly high and impressive- you can walk to top. The water was fast yesterday after big rains. And the foliage stunning.
Wide trail, easy to follow. The waterfalls are just over a km down trail. Beautiful spot to picnic and explore.
Always enjoyable. Noticed a rock feature for the first time and am curious as to what it used to be! Sad that people are still dumping garbage and even hikers not practicing leave no trace.

Terrible trail. While the falls were pretty this is a garbage laden trail with very little to see otherwise. There are far better trails and views throughout HRM. Unless you’ve done them all don’t waste your time here.

The path to the actual falls is just before the bridge, the trek in is moderate. The falls weren’t overly active, but it was still swimable. more or less a washed out road cut though some nice woods. don't go out of your way for it but if you're in the community its worth the walk

Not recommended. Only mud and rocks and nothing to see.

We would have selected a different hike for today as we were planning for more exercise, but still a pretty place to visit and will go back now that expectations have been managed.
Not a bad ride but lake view and water fall makes the ride worth while. Mostly service road ride. Close to home so nice one for me.

One of the best hikes in Cape Breton. A little off the typical Cabot Trail route people take, but a worthwhile stop. Trail took us 2 hours round trip, with a half hour stop at the top to catch our breath from the hike up and the view. 
Trail starts at a relatively unmarked trailhead, and you follow the hunting tape as you make your way up a creek, to the backside of the mountain. Once the incline begins, it doesn’t stop. At points towards the peak you’ll be crawling on all fours up the loose rock, with the occasional rope to help. Utilize the trees and grind it out, because it’s worth the view. 
There are three peaks of differing heights at the top, all offering views of the coast on the left and the highlands to the right. 
The way down is arguably the most dangerous and difficult part, as at times you’ll have to descend backwards to keep your footing on the loose rocks. If traveling in a party, spread out and watch out for tumbling stones. Once you’ve finished the descend it’s turns into a very simply walk in the woods back to your vehicle.

A bit tougher than most trails on Cape Breton. Steep, and gets rough at the top with a section of loose rocks. You may find yourself choosing to do a butt-scoot in order to get down through that section (wear pants you won't mind scuffing up if you think you'll go that route). Bring poles, sturdy shoes/boots, and gloves wouldn't hurt either. Views at the top have a reputation for being among the best on the island. I liked Meat Cove Mountain and Franey's views better but these aren't far behind!

From the lower parking lot below the camp ground the trail commences with great shoreline views. The Bay of Fundy tides are the biggest in the world and the views are best at low tide. Check tide tables  for “Blomidon” to schedule. The lower part of the Jodrey trail is a bit rough and steep. The trail arrives at the south end of the campground and continues at the north end. Follow the blue signs. The upper trail is generally wide with only gentle inclines. The trails from here to the end are generally in good condition though some stretches have many roots. The Jodrey Trail continues to offer great views from a number of lookoff platforms. Long Island is directly across the bay. The Woodland and Borden Brook trails offer easy hiking through mixed forests. At the end of the Borden trail are the Borden Brook Waterfalls. All trails are properly blazed, and there are maps posted along the way. Very impressive and among the tallest in Nova Scotia. An excellent, moderatly difficult hike.

Rogart Mountain ... Joeys big climb!
On a perfect fall day in N.S. Joey Patty & I climbed the 320m, 1125 ft elevation trail to the summit. The trail, in the Earletown area, near Tatamagoughe, is a 6.9km, 4 mile loop with a short side trail. The is Joey’s 4th summit, and is twice as tall as the earlier ones. This is the second highest mountain on the mainland.
We did the trail clockwise to get the steeper climbs out of the way early. The trail is very well marked and on the easy side of moderate in difficulty. It is well maintained though in stretches the trail is root covered. The climbing is never difficult and would be suitable for children. Much of the trail is a woods hike with occasional views. Along the way we had views of 3 different wind farms. We reached the plateau summit with great views and enjoyed the onset of autumn colors. Following a trail lunch, we continued to the second half of the trail which included a waterfall. The falls had little water, but I am sure would be impressive during spring run off. This remote location was settled in the early 1800’s and there are remnants of habitation along the way. The second half of the trail was a gentle incline returning us to our start point at Sugar Moon Farm.
Time well spent.

Paths are clearly marked, the views are phenomenal and never far and few in between, and is difficult enough to keep any part of the experience from becoming boring. Only downside is that since dogs are allowed on the trail, some owners weren’t too keen on keeping their pet’s waste with them and decided to leave some filled bags on the side of the trail for passerby’s to see.

We hiked Bluff Loop this weekend. Challenging but great hike! Saw a bit of toilet paper/baby wipes and candy wrappers that people hadn’t packed out which was disappointing. This is a Tough and long hike - took 7hours. What a gem in our city!
Hiked bluff loop, great condition except take care on the boardwalks on pot lake out and back. Lots of lady slippers. No traffic at all  past pot lake.
love this hike the trail is beautiful and well marked and there are lots of options for every level of hiker.
Trail was in great shape, well marked !
Love the variety of path types of rocks, tree roots, pine needles, creeks. This is my favorite trail around HRM.
awesome! we've hiked a lot out west. trail was well marked good footing and pretty easy
Beautiful hike. Well marked. Muddy to be considered with recent snowfall.
We did the first loop, took a couple hours. Good hike, lots of up and down and roots and rocks. Nice views. Will definitely go back and do more of it!
The pot lake loop is highly recommended for beginner
Less travelled than first 3 so overgrown in places. Great workout!

My favourite trail for a quick city escape! The first loop is the easiest and it gets harder as you go. Plan for at least 7 hours for the entire thing. The fourth loop has very little shade so bring a hat and bug spray!
This is a great trail! Lots of lakes to swim in, make lots of water stops it can get dry out there

Well marked trail, did the entire loop with my dog in 2 days 2 nights, could be done in 1 night 2 days if you're experienced. The nicest camping spot was "moose", private and sunset was nice. The "squirrel" site is definitely a coyote den, they didn't give us any trouble, but wasn't going to sleep there haha. Lots of bugs and ticks in the brush, wear tall socks! Beautiful trail, would do again.

We hiked the morning after Hurricane Dorian, only a few trees blocking the path and most were quick to get around. We did the full trail in 9 hours counting breaks and a 4km extension(wrong path). Lots of ankle deep water and mud, especially on the 4th loop. Check your app when you get to checkpoints to make sure you don’t take the wrong way. Great day and a nice hike, bring lots of water and good boots!
Great trail, well maintained.  4th loop is the easiest (least rocky/hills)
a longer than planned run Over the whole Bluff Wilderness Trail. amazing run, but did not save enough water and energy for the final stretch of Cranberry Lake, which is very difficult

A friend and I hiked this late June 2019. We planned for 8-9 hours and started early on a cool morning to avoid too much heat, finishing up (with two added stretches) completing approx 34 km in 7 hours. We got soaked during the first 10 km in a thunderstorm so soggy boots were the only downfall. The trails were in good shape and pretty easy to follow; just watch you don't take the portage route at the top of the loop like we did!! Overall an awesome day for occasional hikers!

That was a lot of fun!  Went for 2 days -1 night. Stayed at the Moose campsite on loop 4, which was off the trail about 0.3 km up a different path to a lake.  I almost missed it. Went during the week and one of the days was a bit rainy, trail was super quiet and wasn’t even that much mud. Saw lots of flora and fauna. Did the trail clockwise this time and glad I did, as the first bit of the forth loop seemed long and I was glad to get it done before bed instead of the morning. Plus it mixed it up from doing the first 2 loops counter clockwise previously.  I’m sure there were lots of coyotes, there was a lot of evidence of their presence, but that’s wilderness in Nova Scotia. Had cellular service as well. Took about 10 hours in total small breaks and a heavy pack. Oh yes, and don’t use the directions on this map to get to the trailhead, almost dumped me off on the middle of the 103, lol. The other loops have more accurate directions.

fun trail with lots of ups and downs but no major mountains or anything too crazy. if you've done cape chignecto, this will be a breeze. my wife is a first time backpacker and we made it to the farthest campsite (Moose) in a little over 3 hrs.


The first 2 campsites on the blue loop are on rock, so make sure your tent is freestanding (or use rocks to tie down corners is if it's not). the campsite on the last loop (hay Marsh) is good enough for a non freestanding tent with good soil.

trail is well marked and in great condition. wear proper footwear though, as there are plenty of rocks and roots.
Excellent trail if you want to be challenged. It is very well marked. We did the full 30km in a day and it took about 10 hours. Bring a lot of water, snacks, sunscreen, bug spray, and a camera.

Well marked, great camping spots and the landscape changes drastically throughout the trail so it never gets boring. I did it with 1 overnight stay. There was a good camping spot on the farthest loop where the portage trail crosses the actual trail at upper five bridges lake, it’s fairly flat with smooth small gravel and beautiful lake view. At a fast pace it took me 8 hours total hiking but I stopped for breaks which aren’t included

A pristine and well-marked trail. The work volunteers put into this route really shines through! Easy to navigate, with the exception that I accidentally crossed the loop the first loop intersection both times, adding a couple kms.

Went on a day with lots of rain and there was surprisingly little mud.

Took ~5.5hrs to power through at a fast and furious pace, but would absolutely recommend taking a full day to enjoy the views and swim.

Being a runner, I do this the first loop 1-2 times a year. A challenging course which pushes the limits of my abilities. When you do get to one of the look-offs, the views are breath-taking. Plan at least 3-4 hours if you plan to walk the first loop.
Only did first loop. with Megan, Holly and BobbySue

The best trail I’ve been on. It’s a hard days hike to finish this in one day. I hike this trail 2-3 times a year in winter as well as the summer. I often camp one night at the half way point. 

Great trail if you do a shorter loop for dogs and day hikes as well.
Fantastic scramble along the rocks. Lots of hikers out enjoying the same. Super fun for the kids. Couple of muddy bits where little kids need either dry socks or rain boots for
Amazing place! Great view points. Would love to go again.

One of my most favorite places to stroll and scramble in all the world. This is my recharge place; light hikes and beaten trails. Active youth (7-12+) will love scrambling over the boulders.  I love going,  hiking for a bit, settling on the rocks over looking the ocean and just letting life slow down for a bit.
Magnificent foliage, sturdy cliffside trail, and accessible by public transport. No fees! The trail offered pristine views of Atlantic as well as the bay. My 4 year old completed it with no issue.
Very little mud due to the dry conditions. Could not see a buoy due to the fog but could hear it. Lots of scrambling over rocks
beautiful!
10/10 beautiful. Bit of bouldering in midst of the hiking
good parking, well used
a little muddy, but trying up quite a bit.

There was an abundance of sea birds, mostly in the bay at the beginning of the trail.
I have loved this spot for ages. perfect waves during post hurricane. its my go-to spot
nah
Not long but beautiful. Not for “balance challenged” people due to rocky sections.
This is one of my favourite trails near the city. If you're looking for a nice short coastal trail, look no further.
A beautiful walk along the edge of the Atlantic Ocean. The ground can be a little uneven at times but the view is magnificent.

Wonderful views and truly beautiful area . Definitely a bit scrambly and be careful if you take your dog as there are a lot of steep dropoffs to the ocean below. Could have sat on top of the large rock formations looking out over the ocean for hours !!
Nice trail, sweet views!  A nice short walk to start the day

great trail. not too long but some spots were steep and made for a great morning walk with my dog. some of the pathways were very narrow, so having my excited dog on leash was difficult but manageable. No ticks on either of us which was a bonus!
Great little hike. In a sunny day, even with wind, it can get very very hot. Saw a lot of people in rain jacket and all that fun stuff. No need for that on a summer day on the ocean :)
Great place to hike and scramble.
great hike that doesn't take long to complete. lots of rocks to sit on and enjoy the view.
Belle trail, tu peux marcher dans la trail sur le côté ou sur les roches. Il y avait beaucoup de monde, mais surtout au début. Moins vers la fin.
Easy and short trail with beautiful ocean views.
amazing views of the ocean! lots of rocks to sit and bask on. pretty rocky so closed toe footwear is best. also no garbage cans for doggos just be in mind!
Trail ends at private property line. So many trails are hard to access because road close by property owners.

Moderately tricky with more rocks than trail. Great views and loads of spots to sit and admire them. Some (not many) parts of the trail are quite overgrown, if you wear shorts you might find it a bit scratchy.
Great trail along the water. Not recommended for weak knees.
Pretty much a mini Duncan’s cove with out the forts. #Neature

Trail was busy today with lots of people relaxing on rocks and enjoying the nice weather. Breeze kept it comfy but when that was blocked by trees it got pretty warm. Lots of big rocks, amazing scenery.

I can't believe I've lived so close to here and not known about this trail sooner! I was blown away by how beautiful it was and spent hours on the rocks along the way admiring the beauty around me. Reminds me a lot of Peggy's Cove but without all the people!!! 10/10 definitely recommend

Lovely short hike with great views, however there was very few shade spots and it was a scorcher day. Went there by bus and there is a 15 min walk before and after to the bus stop, 9B from downtown Halifax.
Great views. Good photo opportunity. Short. Done in 1h both ways.
Beautiful views! Lovely sea breeze. About an hour start to finish.
great scenery
Pretty easy and beautiful views. If you’re looking for something with the views of Duncan’s cove but without the distance and difficulty, this one is pretty easy and short.
My brother came with me. It was short but we enjoyed it.
Beautiful path along the coast. Some rocky terrain so need good boots. Lovely views.
Beautiful rugged coastline trail. Limited Parking available at the trailhead. Lots of surf and crashing waves against big rocks for lovely photos.
herring cove is very beautiful and this trail is a great hike

great trail for dog walking. morning is nice to walk this trail. very dog friendly. 
recommend.

It was a great day on the trails...a bit wet in areas but easy enough to get around...beautiful spots at the lakes to stop and enjoy the views.

Awesome trails. Each trail has its own difficulty from very easy to some what hard.

one of my faves!
The trail was so lovely with the freshly fallen snow and blue skies over the lake. We hiked it but most folks were out with snowshoes, great conditions for both.
Beautiful trail! So much nature. Not stroller friendly as it's an actual trail, though some parts you can still enjoy with a stroller or wheel chair. definitely going to do this hike again!

Well groomed and very well marked. Lots of signed and history to learn. Various of wide ATV road to woodland path. Bridges in excellent sharp. Easy walk for ages 12yrs and up. Wild life and plants find. Dogs must be on leash.
Great trail. Could have been muddy but we have just had three weeks of super dry weather. Almost all forest paths mostly root and rock.

With Nick and Franny. Almost fell ten times and actually fell once. Fun and challenging terrain
Well marked trails. Further back, less trafficked so overgrown a bit but easy to stay on trail. Variety of footing surfaces. Some scenic lake lookouts.

Did the Old Post Road trail, and cut over through the Wetlands trail connector to the Barrens trail today. Definitely a challenge in the middle part, with some muddy, boggy areas that necessitated a bit of bushwhacking to circumvent. Lots of blowdown, so be prepared to do a bit of climbing. Otherwise, a beautiful trail with some rewarding views at points. Good boots are a definite help here!
Snowshoes not required..a bit of low ducking under a few evergreens bent over trail.

Took Red Spruce Loop. I’m a huge fan of trails that are full of roots and zig zags, with forest overhead - this trail delivers on all three! You get the lake view on the way in if you go clockwise, and full forest coverage on the loop back. Moderate hike with some small climbs/hills.
Very scenic trail system. Well marked. Wetlands Trail has substantial blow down and at one point we lost the trail however with persistence you can push through a short distance and find it again.

Well maintained area and trails. Did the outer loop (cut across at the turning point) with my 3 month old and dog. You have the potential to get your feet wet, as areas can be washed out. I agree with doing the trail clockwise, after your trek you get to walk the wide 18th century stagecoach trail back to the beginning. Will be returning to do the full loop.

The beautiful estate property adds an extra dimension to this visit.  Nice lakeside setting.  I have been completing these trails over a couple different days.  Definitely the Red Spruce, Barrens, and Wetlands trails are more narrow and challenging, with mud, rocks, and roots. I did 7 km on my last visit.  I want to return and do the full 14 km in one day.  Nice spot.
Very mild trail for an afternoon of blueberry picking!

Awesome trail it took me 3 hrs and 38 minutes to complete all the loops in total 14.5 km.Markings were pretty good and last 2 loops were a bit overgrown. 4 lakes in the trail and I would say its easy to moderate in regards to difficulty . Best trail to use during autumn and I really enjoyed a lot hiking through out .

Lot of exposed roots and boggy spots today July 11, 2019.  Take lots of water and trekking poles are a huge asset. The person who suggested clockwise made an excellent recommendation as the old coach road is a welcome return trail after hiking over roots, rocks, and around boggy spots. Enjoy the forest but do not forget water and bug spray.
This one I’ve done a couple times. I enjoyed it and found it was marked enough to get through. Some views of the lake but mostly woods. A little muddy in parts but my son’s dog loved it.

super good trail. there is lots of things to see while waking. also the trail has several different loops and is rated east to hard. you can go 1km walks and you can also do 10km. i definitely recommend you go it was lots of fun!

A great and versatile trail system with something for every. Nice short loops around the house and lake with interesting historical landscape features (old ice house, 200 year old greenhouse foundations, a ha-ha fence etc.) and then two wilderness loops, the barrens and wetlands trail that make for a great half day walk. Lovely sitting rocks for breaks at Thompson Lake, an isolated little wilderness lake at the far end. Best done clockwise, so you get the easy return leg at the end, which is an 18th century stage coach road. Outer loops are not heavily used, so get a bit overgrown, but easy to follow. Good year round. Nice winter snowshoeing when snow is deep. Bit muddy in the spring. The network is well-signed with blazes and handy maps at the junctions and a big orientation map at the trailhead, the parking lot beside the big historic home (really worth a visit when open.)
Awesome
love it here such beautiful scenery walking along side the lake
Beautiful trail! Overgrown in some spots. Lots of bugs, bring bugspray!

This is a great trail for snowshoeing! We have also enjoyed the trail in the spring and fall, lots of mosquitoes in the summer. The trail is wide and fairly level and goes along the lakeshore, turns up into a spruce forest and leads over a hilltop with an excellent view. There are outhouses at the trailhead and interpretive signs along the trail on the history of the Uniacke Estate.
Damn. Don't go if fear of heights
Great trail, well worth it for the views.

Very well taken care of, and easy to follow trail. The section up to skull rock was not easy in all places. Lots of crawling over boulders. But that view is absolutely worth every bit of effort in the climb. highly recommend these trails.
Great hike! Bring water.

conditions a little wet and slippery.  still a terrific trail!

trail is drying up nicely!

A fun trail to spend a couple hours on. It has a few nice lookouts as a reward after climbing some  steep but short rocky hills. Trail does have some wet areas when I did it, and as always proper footwear should be worn.  The trail is very clearly marked at the time of the hike.
good hike... it is well developed and established.
I only did the Bauer Lake loop this time but aiming to do the rest next week. Great hike. Took less than 25 minutes but the scenery was great!

This trail was a moderate trail, a little bit of tree roots. narrow is some areas but it has amazing views, definitely will be going back .  It was a fantastic trail and hike, well marked and they even provide maps
Gorgeous!

Took my 10 year old nephew here today for his first time, he had a great time. We went immediately after rain so a little puddle dodging as was expected. Great family friendly trail especially for beginners this is only his second hike.
Finished our first hike ever on this trail. Enjoyable for my whole family which includes a 5 year old and an 8 month old in a backpack carrier.

the main trail system is heavily trafficked but very beautiful, with views of the water and a really neat bridge. Lots of trails spanning off the main drag, and we really enjoyed this little look off hike! some big rocks and a bit overgrown, so wear a good boot or shoe. gorgeous look offs at the top!
My husband and I really enjoyed this hike, just enough elevation for a bit of a workout and some beautiful views!

Awesome trail. we did the loop and opted to take the uphill climb up to skull rock. beautiful view, but wear waterproof shoes as we crossed a few streams with not the best log bridges. The dogs loved it , however is can be a bit muddy after a heavy rainfall. amazing view. we will be back for sure.

Trail is accessible and capable of through hiking, there is still some icy Patches  here and there mostly on the second half of the trail as you desen, Roots are slippery but if you’re using hiking poles and taking your time should be no issue did the hike with my seven-year-old son we took our time and he was able to make it through with no problem.
This trail has lots of roots and rocks to climb up and over. I wouldn’t necessarily rate it “easy” and I would recommend having good hiking shoes/boots. A fun short trail with a nice view at the top!

Morning solo hike on the Admiral loop trail. Only did the 1/3 of the loop in the counterclockwise direction (up until the harbour look off). Great weather, good intense hike, and some good views while relaxing with a cup of coffee.

Trail is nice and easy to follow. Side trail leads down to the water and another set of buildings.

Easy trail with some neat confederation and WWII ruins. Easy walking, wide path for the most part. Good for kids, dogs, strollers. The app takes you to the other end of the actual York Redoubt historical site but it takes you there. It doesn’t take you right to the cannons and stuff. I had never been there so we went off path for a while to explore. I’d recommend going left on the fork toward the historical site first. The app takes you to some narrow paths that are grown over so feel free to take a look at the map and go where you’d like.

loved it!!!
